intro: Grewia morotaiensis, commonly known as Morotai gum tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the island of Morotai in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy, yellowish fruits. It is adapted to coastal and sandy environments, making it a hardy species that thrives in well-drained soils.
